intro: Freycinetia kamialiensis, commonly known as the Kamialien's palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the island of New Caledonia, where it grows in coastal and lowland forest areas. The plant is characterized by its slender, clustered stems and pinnate leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. Its inflorescences bear small, yellowish flowers that are followed by dark blue, fleshy fruits. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
